title: Problema con invio email da Thunderbird tramite account Microsoft 365 – errore SMTP con OAuth2
creator: zakariamiri.digital
content:
Salve, sto riscontrando un problema con l'invio di email da Thunderbird utilizzando un account Microsoft 365 (tipo aziendale). La configurazione IMAP funziona correttamente con autenticazione OAuth2 e riesco a ricevere la posta.

Tuttavia, l’invio fallisce con il seguente messaggio di errore: Accesso al server smtp.office365.com con nome utente [indirizzo email] non riuscito.

Le impostazioni SMTP che sto utilizzando sono:

Server: smtp.office365.com Porta: 587 Sicurezza: STARTTLS Metodo di autenticazione: OAuth2

Thunderbird è aggiornato all’ultima versione. Ho già cancellato le credenziali salvatee verificato che la finestra di login Microsoft per OAuth venga visualizzata correttamente.

Nonostante ciò, l’invio non funziona. Chiedo se ci sono ulteriori passaggi da seguire o configurazioni specifiche da verificare lato client o server.

Grazie per l’assistenza.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/137.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Unable to Send Emails from Thunderbird – SMTP Login Fails
creator: mateja105
content:
Dear Support,

I am experiencing an issue with sending emails through Thunderbird using my account mateja@flurti.si. I haven't changed any settings, passwords, or configurations, but all of a sudden, I can no longer send messages.

Thunderbird is asking me to re-enter my SMTP password, but it keeps failing, even though the password is correct. I’ve verified all SMTP settings, including the server, port, encryption, and authentication method. Receiving emails works fine — only sending is affected.

Could you please check if:

My IP address or account has been temporarily blocked?

Any changes were made on the server side (e.g., authentication policy, SMTP access, etc.)?

An "app password" is now required for SMTP access?

I would appreciate your help resolving this as soon as possible.

Best regards, Mateja Rijavec Flurti d.o.o.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/137.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/137.0.0.0

title: Thunderbird can no longer send out email
creator: pstrreed
content:
I just got a new computer and downloaded Mozilla Thunderbird, it was working fine and the I had to have the Geek Squard help with installing my printer and the agent that was working on it couldn't help me, so after I got off with him I no longer could send out emails. Called the second time and the agent I had helped with setting up the printer but could get Thunderbird to send emails, he told me I needed to contact you. But since there's no phone number I can't contact you that way and I don't understand how to do it myself (I'm 74 years old) because I don't understand. Is there someone who can help me or walk me through to get my email back up and running please?

Help Roger D. Reed

content:

I do get Mails from other people with other styling Formats (e.g. Calibri Font from Outlook) and i always use arial. E.g. is the visual in my Editor often in Arial but when i send the mail, then i see in my sended mails that the font switched back to calibri. Its annoing cause i always produce Mails with different styles in it. I am using the latest ESR Version.

title: Recently Thunderbird quit working with my RCN email account - outgoing server timed out
creator: woodjim
content:
"Connection to outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.rcn.com timed out". I called RCN support and they said my settings looked OK and I tried various combinations but nothing works. I tried turning off firewall but that didn't help. They suggested I contact Thunderbird.

This has been working for years but my last sent message was 4/27/2024. Obviously I don't use the account much!

Server smtp.rcn.com is OK and I tried both ports that RCN said should work. Connection security SSL/TLS (I tried others). Authentication method - encrypted password (I tried others). Username should be OK too - my name before the @rcn.com. That has been that way for a long time.

Any ideas? I can receive emails just fine.

I am on the latest release. 139.0.1 (64-bit)

Thanks!

title: No way to use Thunderbird auto updates on another computer for shared profile.
creator: john30
content:
We have several windows 11 computers accessing a single Thunderbird profile one-at-a-time. After one of the computers updates Thunderbird with the auto updating, the other computers get an out-of-date with profile message and then we have to download and upgrade to the new version of Thunderbird manually.

It would be very nice if when the out-of-date with profile arises that the user is given the option to update their installation of Thunderbird, i.e., invoke the auto update.

Thanks.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:139.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/139.0

title: No Send Button in Composition Toolbar with no help from existing help answers published
creator: futtleqwip
content:
I have read the already published solutions to this problem. They do NOT work. Here is the situation:

Toolbars checked, as in turned on, in the View-Toolbars box: Composition, Formatting, Status toolbars.

On the Composition screen to compose an email, there is no Send button. Only a Send Later button along with the remaining buttons. I followed the instructions in the already published solution and clicked "Customize" in the View - Toolbars box. The remaining buttons appear in a larger grey box. There is no Send button in this box of choices. I click Restore Default Set and nothing changes. A Send button does not appear in the box of dragable buttons.

Unfortunately, there is no other help available for this problem.

title: Select and change Uppercase to lower case letters in Thunderbird
creator: jim.ramsbotham88
content:
In composing e-mail text, for effective communications, i helps to be able to identify major divisions of text by using, for examples, ALL UPPERCASE, Title Case." Sentence case (another issue.)

I can't find it on this support site; (nor can your search engine.) It seems an odd oversight for an APP whose raison t'etre is communication.

Any help you can offer will be welcome. There are workarounds but all of them add to an already unacceptable burden of having to work around the workarounds that every Update to any software element of the system, however, minor, tends to generate.

Thanks, Jim R.
